title: Input and Output Shafts Assemblies - Removal

body.body: Input and Output Shafts Assemblies - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note that there is a dowel on the output shaft bearing that fits into a hole in the upper crankcase for installation.
The dowel can remain in the bearing or the crankcase when removing the output shaft.
Note the orientation of the oil restrictor washer for installation.
Carefully lift up the output shaft and remove the oil restrictor washer.
Carefully lift out the output shaft assembly. collect the dowel.
Selector Shaft, Selector Forks and Drum - Removal
The input shaft bearing housing fixings may not be reused but should be retained for use during the removal and installation of the input shaft.
The bearing housing and retaining plate fixing holes will only align in one position. Note the orientation of the bearing housing and retaining plate for installation.
Insert the retaining plate bolts into the three threaded holes of the bearing housing.
While supporting the input shaft, evenly and progressively tighten the bolts to draw the bearing housing and input shaft from the crankcase.
The needle roller bearing for the back end of the input shaft will remain in the crankcase.
Second gear and the washer may come off the input shaft during removal.
Carefully pull the input shaft out of the crankcase.
